section.title: Introduction

This quick start document will demonstrate how to use

For details on how to install

you can read here

section.title: Convention - Path Separator
section.para: This document uses slash character (/) to display directory and file components of a path.

Microsoft Windows can accept either the backslash (\) or slash (/) characters to separate directory and file components of a path, while the Microsoft convention is to use a backslash (\). Since
DocumentBurster
is intended to work on multiple operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux), the convention for this manual is to use the slash character (/) to display the components of a path.

section.title:
Download
DocumentBurster
section.para: First step is to download documentburster.zip file and extract it to a drive like C:/

Once the zip file is extracted, a new folder will be available and will contain all
DocumentBurster
program files.
E.g. - C:/DocumentBurster-5.2.8

section.title: DocumentBurster requires Java runtime (JRE) as a pre-requisite
section.para:
In order to use
DocumentBurster
Java runtime (version 1.8 or higher) should be installed on your computer.

section.title: Java
section.para: These days many systems already have Java runtime installed. If yours doesn’t, you can download & install the software from
In Windows Command Prompt type java –version and this command will return the version of Java which is installed on the machine. It should be greater or equal to version 1.8

caption.phrase: It is OK - Java is installed

important.title: Important
important.para: Following is required only if the java –version command doesn't return a correct Java version. Sometimes, on Windows, the java –version command doesn't return a correct Java version, even after the latest java is installed. This is happening because the Windows %PATH% system environment variable doesn't reflect the location to Java's bin folder.

itemizedlist.listitem:
Open the Control Panel - > System properties (WinKey + Pause)
dialog. Select the Advanced tab, and then Environment Variables.

Make sure that the Windows %PATH% system environment variable is updated to include the path to Java's bin folder, e.g. C:/Program Files/Java/jre8/bin
or similar should be in the %PATH% system environment variable. Be sure to omit any quotation marks around the path even if it contains spaces.
Run again the java –version command. It should return a Java version 1.8+ installation.

section.title: Burst a Sample Report - Payslips.pdf
section.para:
DocumentBurster
is coming with a three pages Payslips.pdf document which is located in the samples folder. Bursting this report will generate three output files

itemizedlist.listitem: clyde.grew@northridgehealth.org
kyle.butford@northridgehealth.org
alfreda.waldback@northridgehealth.org

section.para: for the three distinct employees which are found in the input report.
Please check the samples/Payslips.pdf report to see how the burst tokens are defined like email addresses delimited by curly brackets, { and } .

In
DocumentBurster
main window select Actions , Merge, Burst and Trace... , Burst
Once bursting is finished, in the output folder, following files are generated

DocumentBurster
generated a different file for each employee which was found in the sample Payslips.pdf report. The software can be configured to email the individual pay slips to the corresponding employees.

Similarly
DocumentBurster
can be configured to process other report types such as invoices, statements, purchase orders, commissions reports or dunning letters in order to distribute relevant parts to each of your clients, subscribers, partners or vendors.

important.title: Important
important.para: Following is required only if the behavior described below is observed.

para.emphasis: When I select the sample file to burst, and click "burst" it asks if I want to post a new job. When I click to go ahead, it appears to do the job, and then confirms that the job was done. Only thing is, no files appear in the output folder.

important.para: Sometimes the Windows %PATH% system environment variable doesn't reflect the location to Java's bin folder and, as a result, the program does not work and the above behavior is observed.

itemizedlist.listitem:
Open the Control Panel - > System properties (WinKey + Pause)
dialog. Select the Advanced tab, and then Environment Variables.

Make sure that the Windows %PATH% system environment variable is updated to include the path to Java's bin folder, e.g. C:/Program Files/Java/jre8/bin
or similar should be in the %PATH% system environment variable. Be sure to omit any quotation marks around the path even if it contains spaces.
Burst again Payslips.pdf sample report. Now it should work.
